description: Explore the world's landscapes, cultures, and natural wonders

questions.question: Which is the largest continent by land area?
questions.funFact: Asia covers about 30% of Earth's total land area!
questions.story: Asia's vast expanse stretches from the Arctic Circle to the Indian Ocean, encompassing everything from frozen tundra to tropical rainforests. Its size is so immense that it contains both the highest point on Earth (Mount Everest) and the lowest (Dead Sea).

questions.question: Which country is known as the Land of the Rising Sun?
questions.funFact: The Japanese word for Japan is 'Nippon' or 'Nihon', which literally means 'origin of the sun'.
questions.story: This name originated from Chinese documents from the 7th century. From China's perspective, Japan was located east of their territory, where the sun rose. This poetic name stuck and became a significant part of Japanese identity.

questions.question: What is the capital of Brazil?
questions.funFact: Brasília was built in just 41 months, from 1956 to 1960!
questions.story: Brasília was purposely built to serve as Brazil's capital, replacing Rio de Janeiro. The city's airplane-shaped design was created by urban planner Lúcio Costa and architect Oscar Niemeyer, representing modernist architecture at its finest.
